intro: Dudleya setchellii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
